title: Aspiring Salesforce & AI Developer
summary: Highly motivated and aspiring professional eager to join Infoglen's Salesforce Development & AI program. Bringing a solid foundation in Java, SQL, and full-stack development, coupled with practical experience in data management and a strong interest in AI/ML. Committed to excelling through comprehensive training and internship phases to build a career in Salesforce and AI.

bullets: Managed and ensured data integrity for a transactional banking system using SQL, establishing foundational understanding in structured data handling and reliability crucial for AI datasets.

Executed rigorous testing with over 1,000+ simulated transactions, demonstrating strong attention to detail and precision in validating data processes and system outputs, mirroring requirements for AI data quality.

Optimized data retrieval and consistency for transaction history through advanced SQL queries and indexing, directly applicable to curating and ensuring reliability of large datasets for machine learning.
Engineered a full-stack web application connecting farmers with equipment providers, featuring role-based access for Admins, Owners, and Farmers to ensure secure and distinct functionality.
Built a real-time booking and equipment management module using Java and AJAX, reducing manual coordination efforts by an estimated 50%.
Created a normalized SQL database to manage equipment listings, user profiles, and rental histories, ensuring efficient and reliable data access for all user roles.
items.name: AgriRend: Agriculture Equipment Rental Application
items.summary: Tech Stack: Java, SQL, HTML, CSS. Completed May 2024

bullets: Constructed a functional e-commerce platform enabling users to browse products, manage a shopping cart, and simulate a checkout process using Java Servlets and JSP.
Developed the backend logic to handle inventory management and order processing, capable of supporting a catalog of over 500+ items within a robust SQL database.
Enhanced user experience by implementing dynamic product pages and a persistent shopping cart using session management, leading to a 15% increase in user engagement metrics during testing.
items.name: E-Commerce Web Application
items.summary: Tech Stack: Java Servlets, JSP, SQL, HTML, CSS. Jan 2024 â€“ Apr 2024
